CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper October 8, 1960, pg. 33, reads: "Infirmary Gift Aids Pioneer - Mrs. Abraham Lincoln, pioneer clubwoman and civic worker in Pittsburgh, center, is lifted from her bed at Harriett [sic] Tubman Convalescent House by means of Hoyer-Lifter, which was donated to the Infirmary by Mrs. Josie Cleveland, left, an employe [employee] of the convalescent house and Mrs. Edmond Rhodes (not shown) in honor of Mrs. Rhode's mother, the late Mrs. Sarah Seyler. A nurse, Mrs. Lois Boone, right, operates the lifter which was secured through an ad placed by Mrs. Calvin Bartlett (also not shown), civic and club leader in her won right, who wanted it for use in handling her mother, Mrs. Abraham Lincoln. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Mrs. Abraham Lincoln in hospital lift and wheelchair with Josie Cleveland on left, and nurse Lois Boone on right, in Harriet Tubman Convalescent Home
